body.section: Hierarchy PsychiatricDiagnosis is a kind of Diagnosis

section.title: Description
section.p: This class is intended to specialize a generic diagnosis class by adding support for Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM) codes and supports any extensions required to communicate information about Behavioral Health diagnoses between organizations and providers.

stentry.p: confidentialityCode : Code (0..1)
This code may be used to specify whether the diagnosis is sensitive (e.g., carries a social stigma). This attribute relies on the sensitivity value set specified by HL7 Confidentiality coding system.
dsmAxis1 : Code (0..1)
The DSM-IV organizes each psychiatric diagnosis into five dimensions (axes) relating to different aspects of disorder or disability:
Axis I: Clinical disorders, including major mental disorders, and learning disorders
dsmAxis2 : Code (0..1)
The DSM-IV organizes each psychiatric diagnosis into five dimensions (axes) relating to different aspects of disorder or disability:

Axis II: Personality disorders and intellectual disabilities (although developmental disorders, such as Autism, were coded on Axis II in the previous edition, these disorders are now included on Axis I)
dsmAxis3 : Code (0..1)
The DSM-IV organizes each psychiatric diagnosis into five dimensions (axes) relating to different aspects of disorder or disability:
Axis III: Acute medical conditions and physical disorders
dsmAxis4 : Code (0..1)
The DSM-IV organizes each psychiatric diagnosis into five dimensions (axes) relating to different aspects of disorder or disability:
Axis IV: Psychosocial and environmental factors contributing to the disorder
dsmAxis5 : Code (0..1)
The DSM-IV organizes each psychiatric diagnosis into five dimensions (axes) relating to different aspects of disorder or disability:
Axis V: Global Assessment of Functioning or Children's Global Assessment Scale for children and teens under the age of 18
globalAssessmentOfFunctioning : Integer (0..1)
The Global Assessment of Functioning (GAF) is part of the diagnosis on Axis 5.
snomedDiagnosisCode : Code (1..1)

This attribute is intended to store the code for the diagnosis in SNOMED-CT. Since both the DSM IV and the ICD codes corresponding to the psychiatric diagnosis are mapped to SNOMED-CT should be sufficient to represent psychiatric diagnoses.
